summary: The FCC Legal Enforcement Act aims to empower the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to directly enforce its own forfeiture penalties related to violations concerning restrictions on the use of telephone equipment, specifically those related to section 227 of the Communications Act of 1934. It allows the FCC to take legal action if the Attorney General doesn't act within 120 days. The bill also prioritizes enforcement for penalties exceeding $25,000,000 and modifies the regulations regarding unwanted calls from automated telephone equipment.
